intro: Samyda lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved samyda, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Samyda lancifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional medicine.
